contentrichtext.text: {{More footnotes|date=April 2009}} [[Image:Premier.jpg|thumb|250px|right|A man holds a pack of Premier cigarettes.]] '''Premier''' was a smokeless [[cigarette]] released in the United States in 1988 by the [[R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company]]. It worked by heating and aerosolizing tobacco flavour and was intended to reduce or eliminate the unhealthy side effects associated with smoking, both to the smoker and to [[Passive smoking|the people around the smoker]].{{cn|date=July 2012}} The project took several years to develop at a cost of more than $1 billion.{{cn|date=July 2012}} While RJR itself questioned whether the device functioned adequately as a [[nicotine]] delivery device, activists derided it for its potential for use in delivery of other drugs.{{cn|date=July 2012}} It never achieved popularity, as smokers complained about a [[charcoal]]-like aftertaste, and although it looked like a conventional cigarette, special instructions were required to teach smokers how to light it. RJR estimated that it would take two or three packs for a smoker to acquire a taste for Premier, but in practice many smokers only smoked one cigarette and shared the rest of the pack. It was withdrawn from the market in 1989, less than a year after its introduction. R.J. Reynolds reintroduced the concept behind the Premier cigarette as the [[Eclipse (cigarette)|Eclipse]] brand in the 1990s. == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://tobaccodocuments.org/landman/138214.html RJR's Secret Project Spa] - initial development concept of a safer cigarette *[http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/cigarette/ ''Search For a Safe Cigarette'': A History] {{Reynolds American}} {{Cigarettes}} [[Category:R.
